To: TOPIX 
From: Mr. Nocera
 
 
Re: POST OF MY PERSONAL NAME ON GOOGLE
For: Mr. Nocera
D. Davis: Exeutive Assistant 
 
TOPIX ,
 
THIS POST IS ON YOUR WEB SITE AND IS MALISISIOUS AND WITHOUT MERRIT. IN ADDITION IT IS ALSO BASED ON NON "FACT" THE INDIVIDUAL THAT PLACED IT IS USING THIS INFO AND IT IS CAUSING ME AND MY COMPANY HARM IN THE DAILY OPERATIONS OF MY BUSINESS NOT TO MENTION "IREVERSABILE DAMAGE" TO MY REPUTATION AS WELL AS MY COMPANY.
 
TERE FOR IF THIS INFORMATION IS NOT REMOVED FROM YOU WEB SITE AND GOOGLE I WILL SEEK REMEDY
 

 

 

 

Personal Finance

Attorney General Shuts Down Alleged Mortgage Scam Artists
A half-dozen lending companies were shut down Tuesday by the state Attorney General's Office on grounds they had pushed homeowners into "illegal and unconscionable loans." In a lawsuit filed Monday under seal ...

#1 
Mar 18, 2008
 
Judged:

 
1

I'm currently going through the same situation.I refinanced my home loan with a mortgage broker who was employed by Liberty One Financial Group. After my loan docs were signed by me and my wife the broker who's name is Layne Nocera took our docs and forged our signatures and also altered the terms and conditions that we did not agree to, let me also include that a notary public was never present at signing. As a result of this bait and switch tactics we now have a mortgage payment that exceeds my ability to pay. Resulting in my home being on the verge of forclosure. PLEASE HELP !!!!!!  
Diane
San Mateo, CA  Reply » 
|
Report Abuse 
|
Judge it! 
|
#2 
Mar 19, 2008
 
Judged:

 
1

I'm a victim of this. Can anyone tell me what I can do to get this problem solved????? I have a outstanding loan for around $7000,000.00 and I'm living on Worker's Compensation and not working. Please can someone tell me what to do.PLEASE  
Layne Nocera
Chatsworth, CA  Reply »

#3 
May 30, 2008
 
Judged:

 
2

 
2

This is in response to Mr. Armijo"s post of "WRONGFUL LOAN TRANSACTIONS"
Foremost is is important to know all the facts that were in place long before Mr Armijo's new loan was accepted.
In any circumstances involving any transactions or contracts, one should always have their due diligence before they sign any document.
I have been involved in the real estate business for nearly 20 years and with over 4000 transactions, never have I seen such a misrepresented post, in fact there had never been a post with any negative comments such as these,from any of my client's except for Mr. Michael Armijo  
Layne Nocera
Chatsworth, CA  Reply » 
|
Report Abuse 
|
Judge it! 
|
#4 
May 30, 2008
 
Judged:

 
1

I met Mr. Armijo through one of our representatives, who contacted him and Mr. Armijo explained that he had been in a negative amortized loan and wanted out; the person had sold him that product, allegedly again, had told him untrues. My next question is, is Michael Armijo being truthful in his comments, let's set the record straight.

Mr. Armijo's existing loan was a 'NEGATIVE AMORTIZED LOAN" which he received from another loan broker, an that Mr. Armijo needed to get out of that loan because he could no longer afford the payment. We inclined him and provided him with a fixed rate and consolidated his loans so he could afford a payment and pay of " HIS EXISTING DEBTS"  
Layne Nocera
Chatsworth, CA  Reply » 
|
Report Abuse 
|
Judge it! 
|
#5 
May 30, 2008
 
Judged:

 
1

 
1

Mr. Armijo"s claim is truly the kind of comment that is common with the sub prime borrower that wants to lower his payment take cash out, and pay of his existing debts....but does not want to face the reality that they must pay the new loan and the "HIGHER PAYMENT".
It is also a fact that Mr. Armijo took $50,000.00 dollars out of that loan when he said he did not need it.
Mr. Army Howe well knew exactly what loan program he was getting into and he had the right to adjudicate the process at the time, but he did not. So,
in response to this I say that Mr. Army Howe's alleged misunderstandings or wrongs are unfounded without truth and ambiguous.
They have no value based upon what his loan actually was. In addition Mr. Army Howe, never contacted anybody to resolve any others problems.
This is a typical problems that faced most borrowers in the situations. Mr. Army Howe and his wife had no business taking $50,000.00 dollars in addition to the loan program, which they had in their possession for six months.What they did with the money no one knows.
Mr. Armijo did nothing to correct or contact us in the event he was dissatisfied with the loan he received..and he had a three day right of rescission that all borrowers have when executing loan document's.
Again all of his "ALLEGED CLAM'S ARE FALSE AND WITHOUT FACTUAL MERRITT" he had the right to correct anything that he thought was wrong and did nothing about it..why?
In fact addition to this point that Liberty One Financial was never shut down and this website appears to make it that the people on this website were shut down.

This is not true. I hope this may clear up any misunderstandings for anybody that reads this post. Again remember, I have impeccable references and over 4000 transactions to my name. I would not sacrifice that or give that up for one loan transaction.

In addition, I was never a employee of Liberty One Financial. I consulted them and ran their offices as a consultant.
Mr. Armijo claims that Liberty One Financial and myself used deceptive and fraudulent means to for him to sign his documents. Respectfully, Mr. Armijo had a current situation that he needed to resolve or he was to lose his home.
We gave him a program that fit his needs and he accepted those terms. In addition, Mr. Michael Armijo pleaded with us that he didn't need that extra $50,000.00 that was coming in on that loan.
My next question is to Mr. Armijo, why after 6 months he post a comment. he never contacted us regarding the situation to correct any situations before he signed his documents, such as a 3 day notice of right of rescission. In addition, Mr. Armijo's claims that we used deceptive practices are unfounded.

My final comment is "WHAT DID MR. ARMIJO DO WITH THE $50,000.00 DOLLARS? that he had and claims he was going to now lose his home?
You decide..
Thank you,
Layne Nocera  


 

 

Mr. Layne Nocera
